description:
A designation for the technology vendor that provided the record.
CMT=Creative Mobile Technologies
VTS= VeriFone, Inc.
DDS=Digital Dispatch Systems
name: vendor_id

description: The date and time when the meter was engaged.
name: pickup_datetime

description: The date and time when the meter was disengaged.
name: dropoff_datetime

description: Longitude where the meter was engaged.
name: pickup_longitude

description: Latitude where the meter was engaged.
name: pickup_latitude

description: Longitude where the meter was disengaged.
name: dropoff_longitude

description: Latitude where the meter was disengaged.
name: dropoff_latitude

description:
The final rate code in effect at the end of the trip.
1= Standard rate
2=JFK
3=Newark
4=Nassau or Westchester
5=Negotiated fare
6=Group ride
name: rate_code

description:
The number of passengers in the vehicle.  

This is a driver-entered value.
name: passenger_count

description: The elapsed trip distance in miles reported by the taximeter.
name: trip_distance

description:
A numeric code signifying how the passenger paid for the trip. 
CRD= Credit card
CSH= Cash
NOC= No charge
DIS= Dispute
UNK= Unknown
name: payment_type

description: The time-and-distance fare calculated by the meter.
name: fare_amount

description: Miscellaneous extras and surcharges.  Currently, this only includes the $0.50 and $1 rush hour and overnight charges.
name: extra

description: $0.50 MTA tax that is automatically triggered based on the metered rate in use.
name: mta_tax

description: $0.30 improvement surcharge assessed on trips at the flag drop. The improvement surcharge began being levied in 2015.
name: imp_surcharge

description: Tip amount – This field is automatically populated for credit card tips. Cash tips are not included.
name: tip_amount

description: Total amount of all tolls paid in trip.
name: tolls_amount

description: The total amount charged to passengers. Does not include cash tips.
name: total_amount

description:
This flag indicates whether the trip record was held in vehicle memory before sending to the vendor, aka “store and forward,” because the vehicle did not have a connection to the server. 
Y= store and forward trip
N= not a store and forward trip
name: store_and_fwd_flag

decsription: Average speed for this trip (calculated in spark job for composer example)
name: average_speed
